Package de.dirkgasser.brauen

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BrewComputerFrame
    Swing frame control panel for brew computer
    Created with netbeans editor, but 3 step panels are replaced by
    dynamic panels
    BrewComputerMain
    Main Class to start brew computer application
    Developed for raspberry pi
    needs connection from raspberry to brew board
    BrewProcess  
    BrewRecipe
    Brew recipe for beer
    A BrewRecipe contains a list of BrewSteps
    A BrewStep contains information about the step and a list of Ingredient
    BrewStep
    A BrewStep is an action in a BrewRecipe
    It consists of temperature and duration and a list of all ingredients
    which are put in in this step
    BrewStepKeyListner
    Combined Listener Class for ReceipeFrame, part BrewSteps
    The class implements ItemListner for text fields and
    ActionListiner for buttons
    Buzzer
    Java class to handle a GPIO pin of Raspberry Pi as Buzzer
    Pin is taken as Address, so column "wPI" of "GPIO readall" command
    Buzzer beep makes five 300ms beeps
    FullScreen
    class offer a static function to set a JFrame to a full screen
    Heater
    Java class to handle a GPIO pin of Raspberry Pi as Heater
    can also be used to switch on or off any pin
    Pin is taken as Address, so column "wPI" of "GPIO readall" command
    Ingredient
    Ingredient of brew recipe Ingredients are part of a brew step
    IngredientKeyListner  
    JPBrewStep  
    JPIngredients  
    JPRecipeNames  
    JPRecipeProcess  
    Pump
    Java class to handle a pump (or any electric motor) connected to a Raspberry Pi
    via a L298 bridge driver
    L298 inputs:

    in1 in2 ena function low low low off low low high fast stop high low high forward low high high backward Pin is taken as Address, so column "wPI" of "GPIO readall" command
    Class only supports soft PWM.
    RecipeFrame  
    RecipeNameButtonListner  
    RecipeNames  
    TemperaturSensor
    Reads the temperature from a DS18B20 sensor.
    TemperaturWatcher
    TemperaturWatcher calls every 4 seconds the TemperaturSensor
    and write the temperature in the global variable currentTemp
    If the test screen is active, the temperatur is shown there
    Also the delta temperatur is calculated to stop heater in time
    TestFrame  
    TestMain  
    TestRecipe

    TypeofIngredient
